post_text: April 5, 2020 at 12:31 AM#1Hi!im trying to write a macro, which creates a new macro which then brings me to a specific faderpage.for example:SetVar $tmp="faderpage "AddVar $tmp=("input")Store Macro 1.3.1 $tmpThis naive way does'nt work, cause its trying to run "store macro 1.3.1 faderpage 2"Any suggestions?Greetz,Benjo

posts.post_text: April 5, 2020 at 2:44 PM#2hi!Just found the solution.We can put the $ mark before quotes. Ma will then search the variable inside the quotes.Also we have to put '/cmd = ' infront of our String.Least but not last we have to create an empty macro, such as an empty macro line, so we may edit it.now working:SetVar $tmp="faderpage "AddVar $tmp=("input")store macro 3store macro 1.3.1Store Macro 1.3.1 /cmd = $"tmp"

posts.post_text: April 20, 2020 at 10:07 PM#3hii tried around and adapted this parts, together with some other bits i've seen around the web,to some sort of automatic renaming system.it renames some prepared generic track pages, track/song macros, executors and more.the important thing is the position of the quotes. it also works without the /cmd=yes the cli executes the stored commands or stops the process when you call them by $tmp or "$tmp"the cli handles them like copy/paste with the quotes behind the $ like $"tmp"back to the exercise, i prepared the elements for 20 tracks/songs,it's also using the comparator.we need 4 variables, all sections are pre labeled in the same manner.  track-01 .... track-20the main track/song seq's are assigned in page 100macro -track label-setv $tclabeltmp=(track? nr. 01 .. 20)setv $tclabel=(new name)setv $tctmp="setvar $tctrack="ad $tctmp=$tclabel[$tclabeltmp<=20]  s m 1.track-$tclabeltmp.1 $"tctmp"         -pastes the line from variable to track/song macro linel pag track-$tclabeltmp $tclabell seq track-$tclabeltmp $tclabell m track-$tclabeltmp $tclabell tc track-$tclabeltmp $tclabelsetv $tclabeltmp= ; setv $tclabel= ; setv $tctmp=song/track load and prepare macrosetv $tctrack=newsong                                  -line is managed by the label macropag $tctrackse ex 100.$tctrackse tc $tctrackgo tc $tctrackof ex 100.101 t 121 - 100.$tctrackof pag 101 t 121 - $tctrackof tc 1 t 20 - $tctracknoice
